maintenance-item.para: The Interior Message Sign (IMS) displays text strings (text messages addressed to passengers) sent by the Communication Control Unit.

Six IMS units (IMS1 to IMS6) are installed throughout the car. (See Figure and Table .) The IMS units are attached with screws to metallic parts of the wall panels. The metal contact provides a conduction path to the carbody for the heat generated inside the signs. Each unit weighs approximately 6 lb and its extruded aluminium body, painted black, measures approximately 4.0 in. high, 28.0 in. wide, and 4.0 in. deep.

The display face of the unit is oriented towards the center of the passenger compartment or quarter point vestibule. A painted steel mask, attached with tamper-resistant screws, finishes the IMS unit.
The IMS has a touch pad assembly with one pushbutton and three indicators. (See Table .)

A two-plug car wiring cable connects to the 12-pin IMS connector, providing both car battery power and connections to the Data Car Network (DCN). A ground wire connects the IMS ground stud GND to the carbody. (See Table .)
